← Back
Upwave

Building a Platform That Makes Wellness Stick

I led product and design for Turner's health and wellness venture — partnering with IDEO on market validation, then taking it from concept to 1M monthly users in eight months.

The Challenge

Wellness content is everywhere. Making people actually do something with it is the hard part.

Upwave wasn't a design project — it was a venture. I led product management and product design at the intersection of quantified-self technologies and personalized content. After partnering with IDEO on initial market validation, I owned the end-to-end experience: onboarding personalization, the content ecosystem, challenge mechanics, and the TrackIt analytics platform. We introduced lean product methodology with daily release cycles, grew site recirculation from 5% to 24%, and earned a Webby nomination before Turner exited the health vertical.

My Role

VP, Product & UX

Platform

Upwave (Health & Wellness)

Scope

Responsive Web, Mobile, Personalization Engine, Analytics Dashboard

Team

UX/UI Designers, Content Strategists, Data Visualization, Engineering

The Platform

Content, challenges, and tracking — designed as one system.

Every surface was designed to nudge users from reading to doing. The content feeds into challenges, challenges feed into tracking, and tracking feeds back into personalized content.

Content Ecosystem

Category-driven wellness content — move, eat, thrive, relax, connect — with responsive layouts for every device.

Challenge Engine

Multi-day wellness challenges with progress tracking and daily step-by-step guidance.

TrackIt Analytics

Personal health dashboard connecting fitness trackers, nutrition data, and challenge progress into one view.

Personalization

Start by listening.

The onboarding experience opens with "So, what are you into?" — letting users self-select across wellness categories. This felt deceptively simple, but the design of this moment shaped the entire downstream experience: content ranking, challenge recommendations, and engagement patterns all keyed off these initial signals.

The Process

Rigorous thinking behind the warmth.

A product this content-rich required serious information architecture and interaction design work before anything felt effortless.

Information Architecture

Wireframes and responsive layout specifications for the core content system.

Interaction Design

Detailed component specs, user flows, and editorial content structures.

Brand Extension

Design that lived beyond the screen.

The visual language we built for the platform extended into campaign work — sleep challenges, social media activations, and brand moments that reinforced Upwave's voice. "Bring Your Z Game" became one of the platform's most recognized campaigns, driving engagement around the sleep and recovery content vertical.

KC — Design Leadership Portfolio
